items.preText: Shohail: "@tafser real test will come when they will play against stronger opposition. I still prefer liton partnering tamim in the World cup"
items.text: cut away, but the sweeper will cut this off comfortably
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: comes forward and smothers the spin
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: drives this down to long off and picks up another single to keep the scoreboard ticking
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: it was short and he used the depth of the crease to drive it away on the offside. Only a single to the sweeper, though
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: through the vacant space on the offside to the sweeper for another single in that region. No-risk batting here
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: another single on the offside down to the cover fielder
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText: Mahneel Musa: "Remember back in the early days when Taylor used to wear pads inside his trousers while keeping? Was he the first keeper to do it, Debayan?" -- I can remember Brendon McCullum and Mark Boucher having done it a few times too
items.text: played away with a gentle dab on the leg side
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: tucks it off his pads and brings up his FIFTY. What a run of form this is for Imrul Kayes -- he came into this match averaging close to 80 since his recall, and his now 31 away from an average of a 100
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: driven to long on for another single.
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.text: driven to long on for another single. The runs are coming nice and easy for Bangladesh now
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: tries to tuck it away on the onside, but can't get a run for it
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: no run down to short fine leg
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.text: defended off the front foot
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: is that a drop? Raza dropped this a little short, and Kayes went for the cut, and might have had a tickle on it, but Taylor couldn't hold on anyway
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: played to short midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: played to short midwicket
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: driven to covers for a single
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.preText: Sid: "I feel like Imrul Kayes has been very unlucky. He plays decent but still gets dropped. BCB has always looked for flashier and newer toy to partner up with Tamim. These players starts well and then fades away. And Kayes is called back again. He deserves more consistent call ups. "
items.text: straight back to the bowler. No runs for him here
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, no run

items.preText: Jinder: "Barring form, the World Cup XI at the moment would be Tamim, Liton, Imrul, Mushfiqur, Shakib, Mahmudullah, Mehidy, Mashrafe, Nazmul, Mustafiz, Rubel. How's that @ Mr. President??"
items.text: no run, played towards the man stationed at 45 degrees on the leg side
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, no run

items.text: swung away and he connects well. All the way over the man at backward square leg. Wellington has done well to tuck the left-handers up by coming around the wicket, and that was the right way to break the shackles
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, SIX runs

items.text: filcked away through the leg side for a single down to the sweeper
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: driven past the man at short cover for a single
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText: Ron: "Really great 50 from Imrul. A couple of loose shots, but I can feel this guy is really getting it now. I sense this is the period we will all look back on where he finally showed everyone how good he really is. "
items.text: flicked away on the on side. 106 runs for this partnership now
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Imrul Kayes, 1 run

items.text: drives it coolly down the ground to long on, and it is time for drinks from the look of things
items.shortText: WP Masakadza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run

items.preText:
And it is Sikandar Raza to continue with his off-spin

Dilip: "Am really disappointed with the exclusion of mavuta here,he got real potential n talent and definitely is a future prospect for zimbabwe which he had shown against south africa and should not be overlooked just coz of 1 or 2 bad games." -- they certainly need to stem the run flow for Bangladesh at the moment. Only Raza has succeeded to an extent.

Arunabh: "Lots of praise for Imarul and rightly so. I predict he gets out within 3 overs. The jinxing on live commentary has been strong lately." -- that deserves a #micdrop

Radwoan : "I would like to see Sumya to go big n make this position his own. Despite liton making runs he is not consistent and Bangladesh would benefit greatly on upcoming World Cup cause he usually plays better on flat batting and bouncy pitches n we can expect those a lot in England."
items.text: short and punched on the off side. The sweeper comes in again. He's one guy who is earning his salary well today
items.shortText: Sikandar Raza to Soumya Sarkar, 1 run
